citations.narrative:
- Five primary enclosures housing adult breeding pairs of budgies have broken sections in the solid cage floor. These
holes are a potential source of injury to the enclosed birds. Housing facilities must be kept in good repair and protect the
birds from injury. The licensee must repair or replace all damaged cage floors.
Correct by 15 July 2025

- One of the holding pens for juvenile birds intended for sale is overly crowded, with insufficient perch space to hold all the
animals. Lack of space to perform normal social and postural behaviors can be a source of stress to the animals. Birds
that rest by perching must have a sufficient number of perches to comfortably hold all birds in the enclosure at the same
time. Licensee must ensure all birds have adequate perch space.
Correct by 15 July 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
3.150(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
- Five primary enclosures housing adult breeding pairs of budgies have broken sections in the solid cage floor. These 
holes are a potential source of injury to the enclosed birds. Housing facilities must be kept in good repair and protect the 
birds from injury. The licensee must repair or replace all damaged cage floors. 
Correct by 15 July 2025 
3.153(a)(2) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
- One of the holding pens for juvenile birds intended for sale is overly crowded, with insufficient perch space to hold all the 
animals. Lack of space to perform normal social and postural behaviors can be a source of stress to the animals. Birds 
that rest by perching must have a sufficient number of perches to comfortably hold all birds in the enclosure at the same 
time. Licensee must ensure all birds have adequate perch space. 
Correct by 15 July 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
 n
